Message.Title: Motor Contactor conflict, DRV3
Message.Description: Only one of the two Motor Contactors for drive system 3 has acknowledged the activation order.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Causes: A failure of the motor contactor auxiliary contacts or the supply to these.
Message.Actions:
1) Check cables and connections.
2) Check the function of the auxiliary contacts.

Message.Title: Motor Contactor conflict, DRV4
Message.Description: Only one of the two Motor Contactors for drive system 4 has acknowledged the activation order.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Causes: A failure of the motor contactor auxiliary contacts or the supply to these.
Message.Actions:
1) Check cables and connections.
2) Check the function of the auxiliary contacts.

Message.Title: Motor temperature high, DRV1
Message.Description: Over temperature in Manipulator Motor. Make sure to let the Motor cool down before ordering Motors On again.
Message.Actions:
1) Wait until the overheated Motor has cooled down before ordering Motors On again.
2) If optional air filter is used, check if it is clogged and has to be exchanged

Message.Title: External device temperature high, DRV1
Message.Description: Over temperature in External Device. Make sure to let the External Device cool down before ordering Motors On again.
Message.Actions: Wait until the overheated Motor has cooled down before ordering Motors On again.

Message.Title: Motor temperature high, DRV2
Message.Description: Over temperature in Manipulator Motor. Make sure to let the Motor cool down before ordering Motors On again.
Message.Actions:
1) Wait until the overheated Motor has cooled down before ordering Motors On again.
2) If optional air filter is used, check if it is clogged and has to be exchanged

Message.Title: External device temperature high, DRV2
Message.Description: Over temperature in External Device. Make sure to let the External Device cool down before ordering Motors On again.
Message.Actions: Wait until the overheated Motor has cooled down before ordering Motors On again.

Message.Title: Motor temperature high, DRV3
Message.Description: Over temperature in Manipulator Motor. Make sure to let the Motor cool down before ordering Motors On again.
Message.Actions:
1) Wait until the overheated Motor has cooled down before ordering Motors On again.
2) If optional air filter is used, check if it is clogged and has to be exchanged

Message.Title: External device temperature high, DRV3
Message.Description: Over temperature in External Device. Make sure to let the External Device cool down before ordering Motors On again.
Message.Actions: Wait until the overheated Motor has cooled down before ordering Motors On again.

Message.Title: Motor temperature high, DRV4
Message.Description: Over temperature in Manipulator Motor. Make sure to let the Motor cool down before ordering Motors On again.
Message.Actions:
1) Wait until the overheated Motor has cooled down before ordering Motors On again.
2) If optional air filter is used, check if it is clogged and has to be exchanged

Message.Title: External device temperature high, DRV4
Message.Description: Over temperature in External Device. Make sure to let the External Device cool down before ordering Motors On again.
Message.Actions: Wait until the overheated Motor has cooled down before ordering Motors On again.

Message.Title: Run Control status conflict, DRV1
Message.Description: Status conflict between Run Control and Motor Contactors for drive system 1.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Causes: A failure of the Motor Contactors or the supply to these.
Message.Actions:
1) Check cables and connections.
2) Do a Warm start.

Message.Title: SC Not found
Message.Description: The system has an option for Safety Controller (SC) on drive module , but no Safety Controller was found.
Message.Actions:
- Check Safety Controller cabling.
- Check Safety Controller health.
Warm start controller, after performing recommended actions.

Message.Title: SC Communication Failure
Message.Description: Communication error with Safety Controller (SC)
Message.Actions:
- Check Safety Controller cabling.
- Check Safety Controller health.
Warm start controller, after performing recommended actions.

Message.Title: SC Option Not Present
Message.Description: Found Safety Controller (SC) on drive module .This system does not have the option for a Safety Controller on that drive module.
Message.Actions:
- Check drive module software options.
- Install a system with Safety Controller option.

Message.Title: SC Soft Stop Error
Message.Description: Safety Controller (SC) Soft Stop has not opened the Motor Contactors within the calculated time
Message.Actions: Check Lim-switch connection if SafeMove is present

Message.Title: SC PIN Code Request
Message.Description: Safety Controller (SC) has a new Safety Configuration and needs a new PIN code to be activated.
Message.Actions:
1. Log in as a user with Safety Configuration grants.
2. Enter new PIN-Code for the Safety Controller in the Control Panel.

Message.Title: SC Initialization Failed
Message.Description: Safety Controller (SC) failed to initialize properly, or failed to respond during start up.
Message.Actions:
1. Check previous error logs for possible causes.
2. Restart the system.

Message.Title: SC Wrong Type
Message.Description: Found Safety Controller (SC) on drive module , expected .
Message.Actions:
- Check drive module software options.
- Install a system with correct Safety Controller option.
- Install a Safety Controller of the correct type.

Message.Title: SC Motor Calibration Data Error
Message.Description: No Calibration data has been downloaded to Safety Controller (SC) on drive module , or erroneous data.
Message.Actions: Download Motor Calibration Data to Safety Controller (SC).

Message.Title: Access error
Message.Description: Panel Module access error.
Message.Actions: Examine your I/O configuration files.

Message.Title: Symbol conflict
Message.Description:
The signal defined in the IO
configuration conflict with another
program symbol with the same name.
Due on that fact the signal will not be
mapped to a program variable.
Message.Actions:
Rename the signal in
the IO configuration.

Message.Title: IO configuration error
Message.Description:
with signal
name has wrong signal
type. Found expected .
Message.Actions:
Change your configuration
and restart the system.

Message.Title: Resource and index exist
Message.Description:
Resource
Index .

Message.Title: Text database is full.
Message.Description:
Resource
Index

Message.Title: Wrong Signal Type For System Input
Message.Description:
The System Input is configured with an I/O-signal of
wrong type.
The I/O-signal is of type and this System Input
requires an I/O-signal of type .
Message.Actions: Change the configuration for the specified System Input.

Message.Title: Wrong Signal Type For System Output
Message.Description:
The System Output is configured with an I/O-signal of
wrong type.
The I/O-signal is of type and this System Output
requires an I/O-signal of type .
Message.Actions: Change the configuration for the specified System Output.

Message.Title: Not Unique I/O-Signal For System Output
Message.Description:
Each System Output must have a unique I/O-signal configured.
It is not possible to configure same I/O-signal to several System Outputs.
System Output:
Signal Name:

Message.Title: Not Unique I/O-signal For System Input
Message.Description:
Each System Input must have a unique I/O-signal configured.
It is not possible to configure same I/O-signal to several System Inputs.
System Input:
Signal Name:

Message.Title: Unknown System Output Type
Message.Description:
The configured System Output type is unknown by the system.
Unknown System Output:
Message.Actions: Verify that the System Output name is correctly spelled.

Message.Title: Unknown System Input Type
Message.Description:
The configured System Input type is unknown by the system.
Unknown System Input:
Message.Actions: Verify that the System Input name is correctly spelled.

Message.Title: Unknown Mechanical Unit Name For System Output
Message.Description:
A System Output is configured with a mechanical unit name which is unknown by the system.
System Output:
Mechanical unit name:
Message.Actions:
The specified mechanical unit must be configured in order to be used by System Outputs
Verify that the mechanical unit name is correctly spelled.

Message.Title: Unknown System Input Restriction Type
Message.Description:
The configured System Input Restriction Type is unknown by the system.
Unknown System Input Restriction:
Message.Actions: Verify that the System Input Restriction name is correctly spelled.

Message.Title: Unknown System Input Restriction
Message.Description:
The configured System Input Restriction is unknown by the system.
System Input Restriction Type:
Unknown System Input Restriction:
Message.Actions: Verify that the System Input Restriction name is correctly spelled.

Message.Title: The Requested Action is Restricted
Message.Description: The requested is restricted by the system input set by I/O signal .
Message.Consequences: The action called for will not take place.
Message.Causes: System input may be set by external equipment, such as PLCs, etc, for a number of reasons.
Message.Actions: 1) Investigate why the system input was set, and, if required, correct the reason.

Message.Title: Action can not be fulfilled.
Message.Description: The requested action cannot be fulfilled since the IO unit is not responding.
Message.Consequences: It is not possible to decide if there are any restrictions set to the action.
Message.Causes: The requested action will not be fulfilled until the I/O unit is enabled again.
Message.Actions: Never disable a unit with System Inputs/Outputs.

Message.Title: Signal cannot be used as System Output.
Message.Description: The System Output is configured with an I/O-signal with wrong category. The I/O-signal has category Safety and can not be used as System Output.
Message.Actions: Choose another signal or set to another category.

Message.Title: Wrong task name configured
Message.Description: Wrong task name configured for System Output .
Message.Consequences: The digital output signal will not be connected to the specified event.
Message.Actions: Change the configuration and restart the system.

Message.Title: System Output Communication Failure
Message.Description: Unable to set the value of the I/O signal connected to the System Output .
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT
Message.Causes: - The connection to the I/O unit may have been lost.

Message.Title: Motor cooling fan malfunction, axis 1
Message.Description: The axis 1 motor cooling fan on the robot connected to Drive Module does not work correctly.
Message.Consequences: The full meaning of this status is described in the Trouble Shooting Manual, IRC5.
Message.Causes:
-The fan power cabling may be damaged or not connected correctly to motor or contactor unit.
-The fan or the Drive Module Power Supply may be faulty.
Message.Actions:
1) Make sure the fan cable is correctly connected
2) Make sure the fan is free to rotate and that the air flow is not obstructed.
3) Make sure the Drive Module Power Supply output and input voltages are within specified limits as detailed in the Trouble shooting manual. Replace any faulty unit.

Message.Title: Motor cooling fan malfunction, axis 2
Message.Description: The axis 2 motor cooling fan on the robot connected to Drive Module does not work correctly.
Message.Consequences: The full meaning of this status is described in the Trouble Shooting Manual, IRC5.
Message.Causes:
-The fan power cabling may be damaged or not connected correctly to motor or contactor unit.
-The fan or the Drive Module Power Supply may be faulty.
Message.Actions:
1) Make sure the fan cable is correctly connected
2) Make sure the fan is free to rotate and that the air flow is not obstructed.
3) Make sure the Drive Module Power Supply output and input voltages are within specified limits as detailed in the Trouble shooting manual. Replace any faulty unit.

Message.Title: Motor cooling fan malfunction, axis 3
Message.Description: The axis 3 motor cooling fan on the robot connected to Drive Module does not work correctly.
Message.Consequences: The full meaning of this status is described in the Trouble Shooting Manual, IRC5.
Message.Causes:
-The fan power cabling may be damaged or not connected correctly to motor or contactor unit.
-The fan or the Drive Module Power Supply may be faulty.
Message.Actions:
1) Make sure the fan cable is correctly connected
2) Make sure the fan is free to rotate and that the air flow is not obstructed.
3) Make sure the Drive Module Power Supply output and input voltages are within specified limits as detailed in the Trouble shooting manual. Replace any faulty unit.

Message.Title: SC Communication Failed
Message.Description: An error occurred while trying to communicate with Safety Controller (SC)
Message.Actions:
- Check Safety Controller cabling.
- Check Safety Controller health.
Warm start controller, after performing recommended actions.

Message.Title: Enable 1 open
Message.Description: The ENABLE 1 circuit monitoring the Safety System has been opened.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Causes: There may be an internal fault in the Safety System or the internal supervision has detected a fault.
Message.Actions:
1) Check all connections to the Safety System.
2) If faulty, replace the faulty board.

Message.Title: Enable 2 open
Message.Description: The ENABLE 2 circuit monitoring the Axis Computer has been opened.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Causes: There may be a connection problem between Main Computer and Axis Computer.
Message.Actions:
1) Check all connections to the axis computer.
2) Check cables conntected to the Safety System.

Message.Title: Enable1 supervision fault
Message.Description: The ENABLE1 circuit has been broken. This circuit monitors the function of the Safety System and the main computer.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Causes: A fault, probably a software fault, has been detected by any of the units supervised by the ENABLE1 circuit.
Message.Actions:
1) Attempt restarting by pressing the Motors ON button. If restarting is IMPOSSIBLE it indicates a hardware fault in Safety System, axis computer. If restarting is POSSIBLE, it indicates a software fault. In such case, contact your local ABB representative.
2) Determine which unit is faulty by checking its indication LEDs. The LEDs are described in the Trouble Shooting Manual. Replace the faulty unit.

Message.Title: Enable2 supervision fault
Message.Description: The ENABLE2 circuit to drive module 1 has been broken. This circuit monitors e.g. the function of the Safety System and the axis computer.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Causes: A fault, probably a software fault, has been detected by any of the units supervised by the ENABLE2 circuit.
Message.Actions:
1) Attempt restarting by pressing the Motors ON button. If restarting is IMPOSSIBLE it indicates a hardware fault in Safety System, axis computer. If restarting is POSSIBLE, it indicates a software fault. In such case, contact your local ABB representative.
2) Determine which unit is faulty by checking its indication LEDs. The LEDs are described in the Trouble Shooting Manual. Replace the faulty unit.

Message.Title: Enable2 Supervision fault
Message.Description: The ENABLE2 circuit to drive module 2 has been broken. This circuit monitors e.g. the function of the Safety System and the axis computer.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Causes: A fault, probably a software fault, has been detected by any of the units supervised by the ENABLE2 circuit.
Message.Actions:
1) Attempt restarting by pressing the Motors ON button. If restarting is IMPOSSIBLE it indicates a hardware fault in safety board, axis computer. If restarting is POSSIBLE, it indicates a software fault. In such case, contact your local ABB representative.
2) Determine which unit is faulty by checking its indication LEDs. The LEDs are described in the Trouble Shooting Manual. Replace the faulty unit.

Message.Title: Enable2 Supervision fault
Message.Description: The ENABLE2 circuit to drive module 3 has been broken. This circuit monitors e.g. the function of the Safety System and the axis computer.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Causes: A fault, probably a software fault, has been detected by any of the units supervised by the ENABLE2 circuit.
Message.Actions:
1) Attempt restarting by pressing the Motors ON button. If restarting is IMPOSSIBLE it indicates a hardware fault in Safety System, axis computer. If restarting is POSSIBLE, it indicates a software fault. In such case, contact your local ABB representative.
2) Determine which unit is faulty by checking its indication LEDs. The LEDs are described in the Trouble Shooting Manual. Replace the faulty unit.

Message.Title: Enable2 Supervision fault
Message.Description: The ENABLE2 circuit to drive module 4 has been broken. This circuit monitors e.g. the function of the Safety System and the axis computer.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Causes: A fault, probably a software fault, has been detected by any of the units supervised by the ENABLE2 circuit.
Message.Actions:
1) Attempt restarting by pressing the Motors ON button. If restarting is IMPOSSIBLE it indicates a hardware fault in Safety System, Axis computer. If restarting is POSSIBLE, it indicates a software fault. In such case, contact your local ABB representative.
2) Determine which unit is faulty by checking its indication LEDs. The LEDs are described in the Trouble Shooting Manual. Replace the faulty unit.

Message.Title: Not-a-Number
Message.Description:
Not-a-Number was found in task .
A symbol of type '' was found holding an undefined number.
Message.Consequences: The undefined number was replaced with ''.

Message.Title: Positive infinity
Message.Description:
Positive infinity was found in task .
A symbol of type '' was found holding positive infinity.
Message.Consequences: The positive infinity was replaced with ''.

Message.Title: Negative infinity
Message.Description:
Negative infinity was found in task .
A symbol of type '' was found holding negative infinity.
Message.Consequences: The negative infinity was replaced with ''.

Message.Title: Incorrect argument for System IO Signal
Message.Description: set to signal has an incorrect argument.
Message.Consequences: It will not be possible to use .
Message.Causes: The configuration has probably been edited outside a proper configuraton editor.
Message.Actions: The system IO signal must be reconfigured, preferebly with the configuraton editor on RobotStudio or on Flex Pendant.

Message.Title: SC supervision not activated
Message.Description: There is no user configuration in Safety Controller (SC), i.e. safety supervision is disabled.
Message.Consequences: SC cannot stop robot movement.
Message.Causes: There is no user configuration in SC or there is no SC connected in the drive module .
Message.Actions: Download a new user configuration to SC. Activate the configuration by doing a warm start and enter the pin code.

Message.Title: Incorrect argument for System IO Signal
Message.Description: set to signal has an incorrect argument. The delay must not be a negative value.
Message.Consequences: It will not be possible to use .
Message.Actions: The system IO signal must be reconfigured.

Message.Title: Not a valid task name
Message.Description: The task name cannot be used as a name of a task. It is either already used as an installed symbol, a reserved word in the system or too long (max. 16 characters).
Message.Consequences: The task will not be installed in the system.
Message.Actions: Change the configuration of the task name and restart the controller.

Message.Title: Max number of tasks exceeded
Message.Description: The maximum number of tasks, , of the configuration type is exceeded.
Message.Consequences: All configured tasks will not be installed.
Message.Actions: Change the configuration and restart the system.

Message.Title: Not a valid Motion Planner name
Message.Description:
The Motion Planner name for Mechanical Unit Group in is not correct.
The reason can be one of the following:
1. empty name
2. not present in the Motion configuration
3. already in use by another Mechanical Unit Group
Message.Consequences: The system will not be able to use.
Message.Actions: Change the configuration and restart the controller.

Message.Title: Mechanical unit not found
Message.Description: The mechanical unit in can not be found in the list of configured mechanical units.
Message.Consequences: It is not possible to execute any RAPID instructions that use the configured mechanical units.
Message.Causes: The unit is probably not present in the Motion configuration.
Message.Actions: Change the configuration and restart the controller.

Message.Title: The argument is undefined
Message.Description: The configured argument for task is not a valid type.
Message.Consequences: The behaviour of the task will be undefined.
Message.Actions: Change the configuration and restart the controller.

Message.Title: Mechanical Unit Group name not correct
Message.Description:
The configured name of in task is not correct.
The reason could be:
1. The argument is not used in the configuration
2. The configured name is not a member of the Mechanical Unit Group
3. The configured name is already used by another task.
Message.Consequences: The task will not be installed or it will not be possible to execute RAPID motion instructions.
Message.Actions: Change the configuration and restart the controller.

Message.Title: Maximum number of Motion tasks exceeded
Message.Description: Only tasks are allowed to control mechanical units i.e. execute RAPID move instructions.
Message.Actions: Change the configuration and restart the controller.

Message.Title: No configured Motion task
Message.Description: No task is configured to control mechanical units i.e. execute RAPID move instructions.
Message.Consequences: It is not possible to execute any RAPID move instructions.
Message.Actions:
Change the configuration to include a task controlling mechanical units.
Restart the controller.

Message.Title: No members of configured
Message.Description: The configuration type is required in a multi robot system.
Message.Consequences: It is not possible to execute any RAPID move instructions.
Message.Actions: Change the configuration and restart the controller.

Message.Title: Cfg type is configured
Message.Description: The type was found but not expected in a system with current options.
Message.Actions:
Check if the right configuration file is loaded or remove all instances of the type.
Restart the controller.

Message.Title: Unknown event in cfg type
Message.Description: The event is not a system event.
Message.Actions: Change the configuration and restart the system.

Message.Title: Only shared modules in the shared task
Message.Description: The module is not configured shared and cannot be loaded into the shared task.
Message.Actions: Change the configuration and restart the system.

Message.Title: Not defined task name
Message.Description: The task in cfg type is not configured in the system.
Message.Actions: Change the configuration and restart the system.

Message.Title: Module not a system module
Message.Description: The module loaded from the file is not a system module.
Message.Actions:
Change the file suffix or add a module attribute to the module.
Load the module again or restart the system.

Message.Title: Max number of Mechanical Unit Groups exceeded
Message.Description: The maximum number of Mechanical Unit Groups, , of the configuration type is exceeded.
Message.Consequences: Exceeded instances are ignored.
Message.Actions: Change the configuration and restart the controller.

Message.Title: Update of configuration is done
Message.Description: All tasks are reset to its main routine due to configuration changes.

Message.Title: Type error in task configuration
Message.Description: The task is configured with wrong type. Task configured to control mechanical units i.e. execute RAPID move instructions must be of type .
Message.Consequences: The task will not be installed.
Message.Actions: Change the configuration and restart the controller.
